what guide ? what are you trying to do ?
the correct command would be "mysql -u root -p password", password being the one you set as mysql root password (not your user's password)
what error do you get this time ?
sorry I mistyped, there's no space between the "-p" and the password
that's a configuration in your php.ini
check the value of the "error_reporting" configuration directive in php.ini
everything you should need is explained in the file itself
is it this you mean? error_reporting = E_ALL & ~E_DEPRECATED
and you have to run 'sudo service apache2 reload' once you're done with modifying the php.ini
did you also check the "display_errors" directive ?
same file yes, it should be just below the error_reporting one
